function.name: rp_extrapolate
function.description: Sets a flag that allows extrapolation to 1.5*Tmax and returns a verification string. (flag = 0: no extrapolation past Tmax; 1: extrapolate to 1.5 x Tmax)

function.name: rp_getname
function.description: Returns the full fluid name description of the loaded fluid file. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 1 for a pure fluid. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_getcasn
function.description: Returns the CAS Number of the loaded fluid file. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 1 for a pure fluid. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_getvers
function.description: Returns the version of the Refprop Mathcad Add-in. The parameter, idum, is an arbitrary number (ie. 0).

function.name: rp_getNIST
function.description: Returns the version of the NIST Refprop (Legacy API) library and materials properties being used. The parameter, idum, is an arbitrary number (ie. 0).

function.name: rp_getpath
function.description: Returns the path found to the NIST Refprop (Legacy API) DLL being used. The parameter, idum, is an arbitrary number (ie. 0). This function can be useful when debugging the NIST Refprop (Legacy API) installation location or when multiple version are loaded on the machine.

function.name: rp_wmol
function.description: Returns the molecular weight of the loaded fluid [gm/mol]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_tcrit
function.description: Returns the critical temperature of the loaded fluid [K]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_pcrit
function.description: Returns the critical pressure of the loaded fluid [MPa]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhocrit
function.description: Returns the critical density of the loaded fluid [kg/m³]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_ttrip
function.description: Returns the triple point temperature of the loaded fluid [K]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_ptrip
function.description: Returns the triple point pressure of the loaded fluid [MPa]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhotrip
function.description: Returns the triple point density of the loaded fluid [kg/m³]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rgas
function.description: Returns the ideal gas constant used by the loaded fluid [J/mol*K]. The parameter, icomp, is the component number in a mixture; 0 for the mixture value (same as 1 for a pure fluid). The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_psatt
function.description: Returns the saturation pressure [MPa]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhoft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid density [kg/m³]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_hft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_uft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid internal energy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_sft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid entropy [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_cpft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid isobaric specific heat [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_cvft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid isochoric specific heat [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_wft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid sonic velocity [m/s]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_kft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid thermal conductivity [W/m-K]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_muft
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid viscosity [µPa-s]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhogt
function.description: Returns the saturated vapor density [kg/m³]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_hgt
function.description: Returns the saturated vapor enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_ugt
function.description: Returns the saturated vapor internal energy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_sgt
function.description: Returns the saturated vapor entropy [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.description: Returns the saturated vapor isobaric specific heat [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_mugt
function.description: Returns the saturated vapor viscosity [µPa-s]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_surften
function.description: Returns the liquid-vapor surface tension coefficient [N/m]. The parameter, t, is the input saturation temperature [K]. The function is only defined for saturation temperatures between the triple point and the critical point. Temperatures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_tsatp
function.description: Returns the saturation temperature [K]. The parameter, p, is the input saturation pressure [MPa]. The function is only defined for saturation pressures between the triple point and the critical point. Pressures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhofp
function.description: Returns the saturated liquid density [kg/m³]. The parameter, p, is the input saturation pressure [MPa]. The function is only defined for saturation pressures between the triple point and the critical point. Pressures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.description: Returns the saturated vapor thermal conductivity [W/m-K]. The parameter, p, is the input saturation pressure [MPa]. The function is only defined for saturation pressures between the triple point and the critical point. Pressures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_mugp
function.description: Returns the saturated vapor viscosity [µPa-s]. The parameter, p, is the input saturation pressure [MPa]. The function is only defined for saturation pressures between the triple point and the critical point. Pressures outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhotp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor density [kg/m³]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_htp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_utp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor internal energy [kJ/kg]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_stp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor entropy [kJ/kg-K]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_cptp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor isobaric specific heat [kJ/kg-K]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_cvtp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor isochoric specific heat [kJ/kg-K]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_wtp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor sonic velocity [m/s]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_ktp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor thermal conductivity [W/m-K]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_mutp
function.description: Returns the subcooled liquid or superheated vapor viscosity [µPa-s]. The parameters, t and p, are the input temperature [K] and pressure [Mpa]. Each fluid is defined with minimum and maximum temperatures and pressures over which the property curves are defined. Inputs outside this range will generate an error. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_tph
function.description: Returns the fluid temperature in any phase [K]. The parameters, p and h, are the input pressure [MPa] and enthalpy [kJ/kg]. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_tps
function.description: Returns the fluid temperature in any phase [K]. The parameters, p and h, are the input pressure [MPa] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_ths
function.description: Returns the fluid temperature in any phase [K]. The parameters, h and s, are the input enthalpy [kJ/kg] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_phs
function.description: Returns the fluid pressure in any phase [MPa]. The parameters, h and s, are the input enthalpy [kJ/kg] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_pth
function.description: Returns the fluid pressure in any phase [MPa]. The parameters, t and h, are the input temperature [K] and enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_pts
function.description: Returns the fluid pressure in any phase [MPa]. The parameters, t and s, are the input temperature [K] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhoth
function.description: Returns the fluid density in any single phase [kg/m³]. An error is returned in the two-phase saturation region. The parameters, t and h, are the input temperature [K] and enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhots
function.description: Returns the fluid density in any single phase [kg/m³]. An error is returned in the two-phase saturation region. The parameters, t and s, are the input temperature [K] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhoph
function.description: Returns the fluid density in any single phase [kg/m³]. An error is returned in the two-phase saturation region. The parameters, p and h, are the input pressure [MPa] and enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_rhops
function.description: Returns the fluid density in any single phase [kg/m³]. An error is returned in the two-phase saturation region. The parameters, p and s, are the input pressure [MPa] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state pressure and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_sph
function.description: Returns the fluid entropy in any phase [kJ/kg-K]. The parameters, p and h, are the input pressure [MPa] and enthalpy [kJ/kg]. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_hps
function.description: Returns the fluid enthalpy in any phase [kJ/kg]. The parameters, p and h, are the input pressure [MPa] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_sth
function.description: Returns the fluid entropy in any phase [kJ/kg-K]. The parameters, t and h, are the input temperature [K] and enthalpy [kJ/kg]. The parameter, r, specifies if the lower root (r=1) or the upper root (r=2) is requested. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_hts
function.description: Returns the fluid enthalpy in any phase [kJ/kg]. The parameters, t and h, are the input temperature [K] and entropy [kJ/kg-K]. This function performs an iterative search for the state temperature and may be slower than other functions. The parameter, flstr, is a string containing the Refprop fluid file name.

function.name: rp_REFPROP
function.description:
*** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***
Specialized REFPROP call that returns arrays of numeric results based on the input parameters. 
The parameter, "hFld", is a quoted string containing the Refprop fluid/mixture name; may be a blank or empty string if the previously loaded fluid/mixture is to be used. 
"hIn" is the input state point specification. Valid codes are T, P, D, E, H, S, and Q, specified in pairs to identify the values sent in numeric parameters a and b. 
"hOut" is the output code string for requested values to be returned. Multiple outputs can be requested and must be separated by spaces, commas, semicolons, or bars (pipe characters), but not mixed. See ALLPROPS documentation for valid output codes and REFPROP documentation for other special output codes. 
Parameters a and b are the first and second numeric inputs specified in "hIn" and in the stated order. May be zero or arbitrary when retrieving non-state-dependent values. No Mathcad units applied, but values must be scaled to modified MASS SI Units (with thermal conductivity in [W/m-K] and surface tension in [N/m]).

function.name: rp_REFPROP1
function.description:
*** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***
Specialized REFPROP call that returns a single scalar result based on the input parameters and takes no fluid string (it uses the fluid already loaded by a previous REFPROP call). 
"hIn" is the input state point specification. Valid codes are T, P, D, E, H, S, and Q, specified in pairs to identify the values sent in numeric parameters a and b. 
"hOut" is the output code string for requested values to be returned. Multiple outputs can be requested and must be separated by spaces, commas, semicolons, or bars (pipe characters), but not mixed. See ALLPROPS documentation for valid output codes and REFPROP documentation for other special output codes. 
Parameters a and b are the first and second numeric inputs specified in "hIn" and in the stated order. May be zero or arbitrary when retrieving non-state-dependent values. No Mathcad units applied, but values must be scaled to modified MASS SI Units (with thermal conductivity in [W/m-K] and surface tension in [N/m]).

function.name: rp_REFPROPc
function.description:
*** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***
Specialized REFPROP call that returns a STRING results based on the input parameters. This version of REFPROP cannot return numeric values. 
The parameter, "hFld", is a quoted string containing the Refprop fluid/mixture name; may be a blank or empty string if the previously loaded fluid/mixture is to be used. 
"hIn" is the input state point specification. Valid codes are T, P, D, E, H, S, and Q, specified in pairs to identify the values sent in numeric parameters a and b. 
"hOut" is the output code string for requested STRING to be returned. Multiple outputs can be requested and must be separated by spaces, commas, semicolons, or bars (pipe characters), but not mixed. See REFPROP documentation for all character based output codes. 
Parameters a and b are the first and second numeric inputs specified in "hIn" and in the stated order. May be zero or arbitrary when retrieving non-state-dependent values. No Mathcad units applied, but values must be scaled to modified MASS SI Units (with thermal conductivity in [W/m-K] and surface tension in [N/m]).

function.name: REFPROP
function.description:
*** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***
NOTE: WORKSHEET MUST INCLUDE Refprop_units.mcdx BEFORE THIS CALL. 
Universal REFPROP call that handles units in inputs, returns array/scalar/character results, and applies units to numeric output values. 
The parameter, "hFld", is a quoted string containing the Refprop fluid/mixture name; may be a blank or empty string if the previously loaded fluid/mixture is to be used. 
"hIn" is the input state point specification. Valid codes are T, P, D, E, H, S, and Q, specified in pairs to identify the values sent in numeric parameters a and b. 
"hOut" is the output code string for requested values to be returned. Multiple numeric outputs can be requested and must be separated by spaces, commas, semicolons, or bars (pipe characters), but not mixed. See ALLPROPS documentation for valid output codes and REFPROP documentation for other special output codes. 
Parameters a and b are the first and second numeric inputs specified in "hIn" and in the stated order. May be zero or arbitrary when retrieving non-state-dependent values.
NOTE: This routine may be slower than calling the specialized functions, rp_REFPROP, rp_REFPROP1, and rp_REFPROPc or the Legacy API functions.

function.name: rp_SETFLUIDS
function.description: *** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***\nLoads fluid file(s) with a single parameter and retrieves no properties. \nThe parameter, "hFld", is a quoted string containing the Refprop fluid/mixture name. Returns zero (0) if successful and throws a Mathcad error if not. If loading multiple fluids, either the fluids must be accessed individually by setting a single component flag, or must be called immediately following this call to set the rp_setx(x) mixture mole fraction.

function.name: rp_SETMIXTURE
function.description: *** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***\nLoads a predefined mixture file, including its composition, with a single parameter and retrieves no properties. \nThe parameter, "hMixNme", is a quoted string containing the Refprop predefined mixture name. Returns the molar composition of the mixture, as specified in the mixture file, in a vector (array). If loading multiple fluids, either the fluids must be accessed individually by setting a single component flag, or must be called immediately following this call to set the rp_setx(x) mixture mole fraction.

function.name: rp_ERRMSG
function.description: *** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***\nReturns REFPROP's internal error string for a given error code passed in the parameter, ierr. Passing ierr = 0 will return the error returned from the last REFPROP function call evaluated just prior to the call to rp_ERRMSG(0). The full error message is returned as a Mathcad string. The function returns "No Error" if the last internal error code generated was ierr = 0.

function.name: rp_FLAGS
function.description: *** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***\nExactly mirrors the behavior of FLAGSdll , except that some flags are not allowed to be modified in the Mathcad wrapper (user will be warned).\n"hFlag" is the REFPROP Flag to be set or retrieved, passed as a quoted string. Please see the NIST REFPROP DLL documentation for a complete list of valid "hFlag" strings. The parameter, iFlag, is the value to which the Flag will be set. Passing iFlag = -999 will return the current value of the Flag. rp_FLAGS will allways return the currently set Flag value; if it was successfully changed or not. In addition to the Flags specified in the NIST REFPROP DLL documentation, setting "No Warnings" to a value of 1 will suppress any pop-up MessageBox warnings and errors from the REFPROP add-in.

function.name: rp_GETENUM
function.description: *** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***\nThis function returns the REFPROP enumerated value that matches the string sent from hEnum. It is used mainly for retrieving numerical, enumerated values sent to REFPROP and ALLPROPS, instead of strings and follows the NIST REFPROP DLLL documentation for GETENUMdll exactly, except that only the first two parameters are passed and the third, iEnum, is the value returned by the function to Mathcad.

function.name: rp_SETPATH
function.description: *** ONLY AVAILABLE WITH REFPROP 10+ ***\nThis function is identical to the lower-case version, rp_setpath, in the Legacy API. It sets the path where the fluid files are located, but does not change the path for the loaded REFPROP DLL. "hPath" does not need to contain the ending "\" and it can point directly to the location where the REFPROP DLL is installed if a fluids subdirectory is located there. Using Mathcad's Data File browser, the path toan actual fluids file (.fld) can be selected and the parent path will be set.
